tasks.task: Analyzing the impact of climate variability on crop yields and integrating pest management models.
subtasks: Understanding the direct and indirect impacts of climate variability on crop growth and yield.
Examining the effects of rainfall variability on groundnut yield in Anandpur region.
Comparing peanut grow model yields with district yields to identify the influence of pests and diseases.
Developing a heuristic model to simulate the indirect impact of climate variability on pests and diseases.
Determining the timing of land preparation operations based on soil moisture and historical data.
Calculating the impact of leaf miner attacks on yield using criteria based on dry spells and drenching showers.
Assessing the effect of late leaf spot (Tikka) and other diseases caused by wet spells on yield.
Estimating weed loss due to prolonged wet periods around the sowing period.
Integrating the heuristic model into the peanut grow model to project yield loss from pests and diseases.
Evaluating the potential of meteorological predictions in enhancing decision support systems for farmers.
Assessing the economic thresholds for applying pest control measures based on the cost-benefit analysis of losses.
Evaluating the skill of meteorological forecasts in predicting adverse weather events and their impact on pest development.
Recommending optimal showing dates and pest management strategies tailored to regional rainfall variability.
